alternative_parents.description: Monoterpenoids containing at least one aromatic ring.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic monoterpenoids

alternative_parents.description: Monoterpenoids containing exactly 2 rings, which are fused to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Bicyclic monoterpenoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a phenylpropane moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Phenylpropanes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene fused to an oxathiole ring (a five-membered ring with four carbon atoms, one oxygen atom, and one sulfur atom).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoxathioles

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a prop-2-ylbenzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Cumenes

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a meta-cresol moiety, which consists of a benzene ring bearing a methyl group and a hydroxyl group at ring positions 1 and 3, respectively.
alternative_parents.name: Meta cresols

alternative_parents.description: Bromophenols carrying a iodine at the C2 position of the benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: O-bromophenols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a benzene ring which bears a methane group.
alternative_parents.name: Toluenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bromine atom attached to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Bromobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl bromide functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl bromides

alternative_parents.description: Esters of sulfonic acid, which have the general structure RS(=O)2OR' (R,R' = organyl, not H).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organobromides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

class.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a furan. Furan is a five-membered aromatic ring with four carbon atoms and one oxygen atom.
class.name: Benzofurans

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzofuranones. These are organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a furanone.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a furanone.
direct_parent.name: Benzofuranones

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a furanone.
subclass.name: Benzofuranones

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
